com.udeyrishi.androidelasticsearchdatamanager.elasticsearchhelpers

Class ElasticSearchHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.udeyrishi.androidelasticsearchdatamanager.elasticsearchhelpers.ElasticSearchHelper

  • public class ElasticSearchHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A set for helped APIs for interacting with Elastic Search server. Created by rishi on 15-11-12.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ElasticSearchHelper(java.lang.String elasticSearchRootUrl)
      Creates an instance of ElasticSearchHelper.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkPathExists(java.lang.String suffix)
      Makes an HTTP GET request at the path formed with provided suffix, and checks for the response to see if the path exists.
      java.lang.String getJson(java.lang.String suffix)
      Makes an HTTP GET request at the URL formed with the provided suffix, and returns the received JSON String if an HTTP OK is received.
      java.lang.String postJson(java.lang.String json, java.lang.String suffix)
      Makes an HTTP POST request at the URL formed with the provided suffix, and checks for the response code to be a successful one.
      java.lang.String putJson(java.lang.String json, java.lang.String suffix)
      Makes an HTTP PUT request at the URL formed with the provided suffix, and checks for the response code to be a successful one.
      boolean sendDeleteRequestAtPath(java.lang.String suffix)
      Sends an HTTP DELETE request at the path formed with the provided suffix.

    • Method Detail

      • getJson

        public java.lang.String getJson(java.lang.String suffix)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Makes an HTTP GET request at the URL formed with the provided suffix, and returns the received JSON String if an HTTP OK is received. If HTTP NOT-FOUND is received, android.content.res.Resources.NotFoundException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        suffix - The suffix to be used for making the request.
        Returns:
        The retrieved JSON string if the HTTP OK is received.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the network communication fails.

      • putJson

        public java.lang.String putJson(java.lang.String json,
                       java.lang.String suffix)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Makes an HTTP PUT request at the URL formed with the provided suffix, and checks for the response code to be a successful one.
        Parameters:
        json - The JSON string to be sent.
        suffix - The suffix to be used for making the request.
        Returns:
        The response to the request.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the network communication fails.

      • postJson

        public java.lang.String postJson(java.lang.String json,
                        java.lang.String suffix)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Makes an HTTP POST request at the URL formed with the provided suffix, and checks for the response code to be a successful one.
        Parameters:
        json - The JSON string to be sent.
        suffix - The suffix to be used for making the request.
        Returns:
        The response to the request.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the network communication fails.

      • checkPathExists

        public boolean checkPathExists(java.lang.String suffix)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Makes an HTTP GET request at the path formed with provided suffix, and checks for the response to see if the path exists.
        Parameters:
        suffix - The suffix to be used for making the request.
        Returns:
        If the HTTP response is OK, returns true. If the response is NOT-FOUND, returns false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the network communication fails.

      • sendDeleteRequestAtPath

        public boolean sendDeleteRequestAtPath(java.lang.String suffix)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Sends an HTTP DELETE request at the path formed with the provided suffix.
        Parameters:
        suffix - The suffix to be used for making the request.
        Returns:
        True, if the response is OK (i.e., path existed). False, if the response is NOT-FOUND (i.e., path didn't exist).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the network communication fails.
